newsitem.title: NORWAY: ALPINE SKIING-MEN'S DOWNHILL TRAINING CANCELLED.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-MEN'S DOWNHILL TRAINING CANCELLED.

text.p: Training for a men's Alpine ski World Cup downhill was cancelled on Friday because of rain and fog.
Bad weather all week has limited skiers to just one training run on Thursday on the 3,035-metre Olympiabakken course.
Luc Alphand of France, who leads the downhill and super-G rankings and has an opportunity to sew up both titles this weekend, posted the fastest time on Thursday.
The penultimate downhill of the season is scheduled for Saturday followed by a super-G on Sunday.
